intro: Kadua cordata subsp. remyi, commonly known as the slender kadua, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its inflorescence consists of both ray and disk flowers, with the ray florets typically being pink or purple in color. This species is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
